feed.title: SAP Community - Cloud Integration
feed.subtitle: Cloud Integration Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Comparing Two XML Element Groups Using XSLT: A Practical Approach for Data Synchronization
entry.content:
In today‚Äôs enterprise integration landscape, maintaining data consistency across systems is a recurring challenge. Whether integrating SAP S/4HANA, SuccessFactors, or third-party applications via SAP Cloud Integration, comparing two XML payloads to detect changes is a critical task.

This blog post walks through a common integration scenario: comparing two XML structures using XSLT to identify what has changed and needs to be synchronized. We'll detect added and updated elements and generate a clean delta XML for downstream processing.

üìò Use Case

Imagine the following XML document representing two data sources:

 

We aim to compare R1 (source) and User (target) to detect:

  • Fields in R1 missing in User ‚Üí flagged as ADD

  • Fields in both, but with different values ‚Üí flagged as UPDATE

  • Nested elements like Address are also compared deeply

üõ† XSLT Logic

Below is the complete XSLT 1.0 code that performs the comparison and outputs the results in a <Root><R2> structure. This can be used in SAP Cloud Integration‚Äôs message mappings, PI/PO mappings, or any tool that supports XSLT.

‚úÖ Full XSLT Code

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<xsl:stylesheet version="1.0"
  xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform">
  
  <xsl:output method="xml" indent="yes"/>

  <xsl:template match="/Main">
    <Root>
      <R2>
        <xsl:variable name="r1" select="R1"/>
        <xsl:variable name="r2" select="User"/>

        <!-- Add operation: elements present in R1 but not in User -->
        <xsl:for-each select="$r1/*">
          <xsl:variable name="name" select="name()"/>
          <xsl:if test="not($r2/*[name() = $name])">
            <Add>
              <operation>ADD</operation>
              <xsl:copy-of select="."/>
            </Add>
          </xsl:if>
        </xsl:for-each>

        <!-- Update operation -->
        <xsl:for-each select="$r1/*">
          <xsl:variable name="name" select="name()"/>
          <xsl:variable name="r1node" select="."/>
          <xsl:variable name="r2node" select="$r2/*[name() = $name]"/>

          <!-- Direct value changes (non-nested) -->
          <xsl:if test="$r2node and not($r1node/*) and normalize-space($r1node) != normalize-space($r2node)">
            <update>
              <operation>Update</operation>
              <xsl:copy-of select="$r1node"/>
            </update>
          </xsl:if>

          <!-- Nested structure comparison -->
          <xsl:if test="$r1node/* and $r2node/*">
            <xsl:variable name="hasDifference">
              <xsl:for-each select="$r1node/*">
                <xsl:variable name="subname" select="name()"/>
                <xsl:variable name="r1sub" select="."/>
                <xsl:variable name="r2sub" select="$r2node/*[name() = $subname]"/>
                <xsl:if test="normalize-space($r1sub) != normalize-space($r2sub)">
                  <xsl:text>yes</xsl:text>
                </xsl:if>
              </xsl:for-each>
            </xsl:variable>
            <xsl:if test="contains($hasDifference, 'yes')">
              <update>
                <operation>Update</operation>
                <xsl:copy-of select="$r1node"/>
              </update>
            </xsl:if>
          </xsl:if>
        </xsl:for-each>
      </R2>
    </Root>
  </xsl:template>
</xsl:stylesheet>

üßæ Sample Output

With the above input and XSLT, the result is:

This output structure is ideal for triggering update APIs, generating change logs, or sending notification messages.


Sure! Here's a revised version of your closing paragraph, tailored specifically to the context of the XML element group comparison post:

If you're working with XML transformations in SAP Cloud Integration (CPI) and need to identify differences between nested XML structures, this XSLT-based approach can save you hours of manual comparison and debugging.

Have you encountered similar scenarios in CPI where comparing XML payloads was necessary? Share your solutions, questions, or challenges in the comments‚Äîlet‚Äôs learn from each other!

entry.title: Duplicate file check in sFTP adapter BTP cloud integration

entry.title: SAP SuccessFactors Integration with BigQuery

I am looking for guidance on how to connect SAP SuccessFactors with Google BigQuery.

  • Whether to use Integration Center, SAP CPI, or any other method
  • Any documentation, experiences, or lessons learned from those who have done something similar

Would appreciate any help or pointers you can share. Thank you.

entry.title: Error List for Production Order Confirmation & A_MaterialDocumentHeader
entry.content:
Hello experts!

A customer wants to differentiate errors in S/4 Public Cloud, so that ALM can send them to different e-mail-addresses. One for technical issues, one for process issues and one general.

For that, we have to check the code which is in the response from S/4 when the Integration Suite tries for example to update an production order.

{
  "code": "RU/494",
  "message": {
    "@lang": "en",
    "$": "Order 1000510 closed"
  }
}

For now we identified the code RU/494, CO/469 & CO/030

The following endpoints are used:

  • API_PRODUCTION_ORDER_2_SRV/A_ProductionOrder_2
  • API_MATERIAL_DOCUMENT_SRV/A_MaterialDocumentHeader

Is there a list, where the codes are displayed with the message? I didn't found it on the api hub or business documentation.
Or did I miss it maybe?

Thank you!

entry.title: Simulation vs Runtime Discrepancy in B2B MAG-
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I'm working on a B2B integration scenario using SAP Integration Suite with Integration Advisor, mapping IDoc DELVRY05 to EDI X12 856. The mapping is fully MAG-compliant, and I‚Äôm using XSLT logic to calculate and generate the DTM*017 segment.

Problem,

When I simulate the message in Integration Advisor, the DTM*017 segment is generated correctly.

However, when the same message is processed in a real B2B runtime scenario, the segment is not generated at all ‚Äî even though the payload is identical in both cases.

entry.title: SAP Integration Suite: File not archived correctly post processing
entry.content:
Hello Community,

In Production instance, message was processed and posted in SAP system via SAP-Integration Suite. However, the file was not archived correctly.

Due to these, SAP CPI continued to pick the file and try to process it again and again. The interface pricks triplet to process the file. The three files are filename.xml, filename.txt and filename.pdf. The last two files were archived by the filename.xml was not processed correctly. 

Error Details:

org.apache.camel.CamelExchangeException: Error occurred during aggregation. Exchange[BF06DD831FBA19F-0000000000000002]. Caused by: [org.apache.camel.RuntimeExchangeException - Polling with given parameters did not return any message.], cause: org.apache.camel.RuntimeExchangeException: Polling with given parameters did not return any message.

These is the second time when the post processing of file was not done correctly by SAP CI. What could be the issue and how these can be averted.

 

Regards

Nageshwarnath Mishra

entry.title: Query for SAP CPI GET Datastore search processing time
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community, 

When using the GET DataStore Operation in SAP CPI, does anyone have an idea how long it takes to search an entry in the datastore if the datastore contains let's say more than 10,000 entries? 

Thank you so much. 

Best Regards, 

Jerome

entry.title: CPI and Azure storage adapter - huge file size issue - file not read completely from the blob
entry.content:
Hi,

We have a simple flow to get the json file from the storage container and then send it to HTTPS
We have worked with files as big as 87 MB and there was never any issue
However, it is failing with a larger file of 105 MB and it seems that even in the download section in trace, the file is not downloaded fully which means that the iflow did not pick up the full file
I downloaded the message payload but the file is incomplete and what i need to resolve why the message payload is incomplete in the iflow and how can the complete file be processed
When this incomplete message hits the HTTPS which is then received by the REST which is expecting a fully formed JSON, it fails
The iflow is just passing the data payload to target as the target is expecting full and valid json payload, it raises the exception
So i need to be able to find why the payload from the blob is not coming through in full

The flow is really simple -

Connect to the Blob container
Read the JSON data file (this file will be the ONLY file always and is overwritten by the new file on a daily basis with the same name)
Send the data file records to PI REST Sender adapter and get it processed by SAP inbound proxy

The List Blob operation is via the Receiver Azure Storage Adapter with message protocol as BLOB Storage
So how to confirm that the file is not read fully or is incomplete?
Azure Storage adapter is standard
The actual GET to access the file in the blob after get Blob is HTTP as per the examples in the few blogs that i could find
Is there another way to read the data file in the blob container via Azure Storage adapter as i have not seen any operation for actually getting the file data?

So is there a standard way to send JSON data to PI from CPI/Azure Blob?
Can you please advise (maybe some blogs and links that i can check)?

I have also checked the option of doing a local process call but not sure what condition to use to do the loop or terminate.

I even tried looking at the blog where the file is downloaded by the groovy script/using azure storage jar file but i am getting some error by using the same connection that i am using in the iflow to successfully connect to the azure blob

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/get-file-from-azureblob-using-cpi-using-azure-storage-jar/ba-p/13503570

Any advise is also appreciated 

Regards,

Archana

Thanks,

Nidhi Srivastava

entry.title: Range based Select operation on Datastore using any header or groovy script
entry.content:
Here's my scenario:

  • The Datastore contains 100+ entries.
  • The iflow receives a query parameter start_index from the HTTPS request.
  • Based on this, the iflow should return entries from start_index to start_index + offset, where offset is a configurable property (e.g., 10).

Is there any standard SAP header or a groovy script which can be leveraged to achieve this kind of paginated Select operation on the Datastore?

entry.title: Using Function Import on oData v 2.0 API_OUTBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV;v=0002 to perform PickOneItem
entry.content:
Using Function Import on oData v 2.0 to perform PickOneItem.  I can get it to work in Postman but I receive the error ‚Äúcom.sap.gateway.core.ip.component.odata.exception.OsciException: Precondition Required : 428 : HTTP/1.1‚Äù in CPI.

My assumption is that this is related to the if-match header with the etag but as far as I can see this is correct.

These are the steps I have gone through in Postman to prove the API works

  1. Run the GET method of the odata to retrieve the CSRF and the etag
    https://xxxx.xxxx.xxxx.xxxx:xxxx/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_OUTBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV;v=0002/A_OutbDeliveryItem?$filter=DeliveryDocument eq '83782271' and DeliveryDocumentItem eq '000010'
  2. Retrieved the csrf from the x-csrf-token and the etag from the body
  3. Executed the PickOneItem odata
    https://xxxx.xxxx.xxxx.xxxx:xxxx/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_OUTBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV;v=0002/PickOneItem?DeliveryDocument='83782271'&DeliveryDocumentItem='10'
    Copying the CSRF into the x-csrf-token and the etag into the If-Match parameter from 2
  4. This resulted in the picked item quantity being set to the delivered quantity as expected for this item

I then created an iFlow to replicate this as shown in attachment

 

On the PickOneItem I get the error com.sap.gateway.core.ip.component.odata.exception.OsciException: Precondition Required : 428 : HTTP/1.1. 

Any ideas as to suggestions as to what I have missed?

entry.title: PKIX path building failed Cloud Integration
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We are getting the connectivity error between iflow (HTTP receiver adapter) and IBM MQ in SAP Integration Suite (Cloud Integration).. It was working fine until yesterday..

Error code on Monitoring: (screenshot2)

Error code HTTP response body:

javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: sun.security.validator.ValidatorException: PKIX path building failed: sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException: unable to find valid certification path to requested target..

we have imported all the Root and Issuing certificates shared by IBM MQ team (screenshot1)

Should we also import server certificate of IBM MQ server?

 

Regards,

Ramu.

screenshot1

screenshot2
